Class Final

java.lang.Object
Final
public class Final
extends java.lang.Object
this class solves the first algorithms and programming 1 laboratory

    • initialize

      public static void initialize()
      this method initializes the variables needed for the execution of the programm pre: post: the variables are initialized so that they can be used without an error being thrown by the machine

    • words

      public static void words()
      this method solves the first part of the laboratory regarding strings, it receives three strings, concatenates them, shows the length of each of them, and prints the character selected for each of the string. pre: post: print the concatenation, the length, and the character selected of the strings.

    • numbers

      public static void numbers()
      this method receives two integer numbers greaters than zero, prints their division and the whole part of the modulus. pre: post: the resul of dividing the first number between the second and the whole part of the modulus of the first number between the second.

    • arrays

      public static void arrays()
      method arrays is the largest one, it receives three arrays, shows them to the user, calculate the mode, average and the greater value of the array selected by the user. it calculates the sum, subtraction or multiplication between the arrays selected by the user. it makes the union of the arrays, makes an array without the repeated numbers, and an array with the interception of the arrays. Also, it can order the elements of an array(from lowest to greatest) and move the positions of the elements to the n-th time. pre: post: to give the results of the processes mentioned above.

    • enterarrays

      public static int[] enterarrays​(int[] array)
      this method asks the user for the length of an array and for its elements. pre: the array must have been initialized. post: returns an array.
      Parameters:
      array - . is the array which will be entered.
      Returns:
      array. the array entered by the user.

    • menu

      public static void menu()
      this method is the menu the user will see and interact with, it will tell the client the options of the programm. pre: post: to allow the client to navigate throw the programm.

    • printarrays

      public static void printarrays​(int[] array)
      this method prints a given array. pre: the array exists. array != null. post: show in screen the array.
      Parameters:
      array - . is the array to print.

    • mode

      public static void mode​(int[] array)
      this method calculates the number that is most repeated in a given array. pre: the array exists. array != null. post: finds the mode.
      Parameters:
      array - . is the array in which the method will search the number.

    • sumarrays

      public static void sumarrays​(int[] array1, int[] array2)
      this method calculates the sum between the elements of given arrays. pre: both of the arrays exists. array1 != null and array2 != null. also, the arrays have the same length. post: the sum between the elements of the arrays.
      Parameters:
      array1 - . the first array
      array2 - . the second array

    • secondmenu

      public static void secondmenu​(int option1, int option2)
      this method is a menu having the options of making the sum, subtraction or multiplication between arrays, depending on the choice made by the client. pre: the two options(choices made by the client) exists. option1 != null and option2 != null. post: to make the operation selected by the client.
      Parameters:
      option1 - . is the choice that indicates what kind of operation the user wants to do( sum, subtraction or multiplication).
      option2 - . is the choice that indicates between what arrays the user wants to make that operation.

    • combinationarrays

      public static int[] combinationarrays​(int[] array1, int[] array2, int[] array3)
      this method makes the union of the arrays. pre: the three arrays exists. array1 != null and array2 != null and array3 != null. post: the union of the arrays.
      Parameters:
      array1 - . the first array.
      array2 - . the second array.
      array3 - . the third array.
      Returns:
      newarray2. the union of the three arrays.

    • norepeatednumbersarray

      public static int[] norepeatednumbersarray​(int[] array)
      this method creates the array without repeated numbers. pre: the union of the arrays must have been already done. post: the array without repeated numbers.
      Parameters:
      array - . is the union of the entered arrays.
      Returns:
      newarray. the array with no repeated numbers.

    • bubble

      public static int[] bubble​(int[] array)
      this method organizes the elements of an array from the lowest to the greatest value. pre: the chosen array exists. array != null. post: the entered array but organized.
      Parameters:
      array - . is the array.
      Returns:
      array. the organized array.

    • moveelements

      public static int[] moveelements​(int[] array)
      this method moves the positions of the elements of an array to the n-th time( the number the user wants). pre: the array exists. array != null. post: the array with it's elements moved.
      Parameters:
      array - . is the array.
      Returns:
      array. is the array with its positions moved.

    • interception

      public static void interception​(int[] array1, int[] array2, int[] array3)

      Parameters:
      array1 - . the first array.
      array2 - . the second array.
      array3 - . the third array.
